content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following interconnected entities that aim to receive and process materials for copper cable production:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• New factory burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (retrieved for connection)
• Dedicated burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed with direction RIGHT
• Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) acting as the production interface

### Belt Depot Structure at (3.5, 15.5)
Formed to consolidate transport belt connections while avoiding direct linkage to prohibited targets:
• Wooden chest serving as an isolated belt depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) (crafted and successfully placed)
• Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (placed with direction UP) with its pickup at (3.5,15.5) and drop at (3.5,13.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors
  – Avoid attempting to connect transport belts directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always add an intermediate inserter for input into the steam engine rather than connecting directly.
  
• Placement Range and Inventory Issues
  – Ensure the player is within the maximum allowable distance to the target position before attempting to place an entity (e.g. wooden chest placement failure due to target being too far).
  – Verify that the required item is present in the inventory (e.g. wooden chest missing) or craft it beforehand.
  
• Variable Naming Consistency
  – Confirm that all variables (such as the target chest reference) are correctly defined to prevent NameError exceptions.
